metadata.title: CVE-2017-13081 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - high.
metadata.description: Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA and WPA2) that supports IEEE 802.11w allows reinstallation of the Integrity Group Temporal Key (IGTK) during the group key handshake, allowing an attacker within radio range to spoof frames from access points to clients.

notes.note: mdeslaur> related to intel wireless firmware issue CVE-2017-5729

criterions.comment: wpa package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4-0ubuntu10').
